summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It details logistical arrangements for the public and victims to attend the hearing, including COVID-19 protocols and teleconference access.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, issuing the order regarding the arraignment logistics.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse.

events.title: Deadline for Victim and Family Attendance Notification
events.description: Deadline for the Government and defense counsel to inform the court whether alleged victims or the defendant's family members wish to attend the arraignment.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: An arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on a superseding indictment (S2) is scheduled for April 23, 2021.
Due to significant public interest, the court is providing multiple access methods: in-person viewing in overflow rooms and a public teleconference line for audio.
The order references the Crime Victims' Rights Act (18 U.S.C. ยง 3771), requiring the government to notify victims of the proceeding.
Strict COVID-19 protocols are in place for courthouse entry, including a health questionnaire, temperature check, and specific mask requirements.
